newsitem.title: SPAIN: Three babies die in Spanish day-care centre fire.
newsitem.headline: Three babies die in Spanish day-care centre fire.

text.p: Three babies died and a woman was badly burned when fire swept through the attic bedroom of a day-care centre in northwestern Spain on Friday, police said.
The one-year-olds had been sleeping in the attic when the fire broke out at about noon, engulfing the wooden roof and causing it to collapse.
The woman, a worker at the centre, suffered burns on 50 percent of her body and a fireman suffered from smoke inhalation as they tried to rescue the infants.
Panicky parents rushed to the centre in the port city of Vigo, but the other children escaped unharmed, Vigo's mayor said.
The blaze could have been started by a short-circuit in the 20-year-old house, he said, adding that firefighters were still investigating.
